content:
AuthorizationRule Class

In this Article

The AuthorizationRule class allows you to programmatically access and modify the authorization section of a configuration file. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class AuthorizationRule : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
  • AuthorizationRule

Remarks

The AuthorizationRule class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the authorization section of a configuration file.

This type is part of a group that includes the AuthorizationSection, the AuthorizationRuleCollection, and the AuthorizationRuleAction types.

Note

The AuthorizationSection can update the configuration information at any level in the configuration hierarchy.

Constructors

  • AuthorizationRule(AuthorizationRuleAction)

    Creates a new instance of the AuthorizationRule class using the passed object.

    public AuthorizationRule (System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRuleAction action);

    Parameters

    • action
      AuthorizationRuleAction

      The AuthorizationRule object to use to initialize the new instance.

    Remarks

    The AuthorizationRule constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.

Properties

  • Action

    Gets or sets the AuthorizationRule action.

    public System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRuleAction Action { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • AuthorizationRuleAction

      One of the AuthorizationRuleAction values.

    Remarks

    At run time, the authorization module iterates through allow and deny elements until it finds the first access rule that fits a particular user. It then grants or denies access to a URL resource depending on whether the first access rule found is allow or deny. Access is allowed by default.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use this property. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
           
            // Set the action property.
            authorizationRule.Action = 
               AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow;
            // Define the new rule to add to the collection.
            authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName");
            authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin");
            authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST");

            // Add the new rule to the collection.
            authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
      ' Set the action property.
        authorizationRule.Action = _
        AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow
      ' Define the new rule to add to the collection.
      authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName")
      authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin")
      authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST")
      
      ' Add the new rule to the collection.
      authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule)
  • Properties
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ConfigurationPropertyCollection

      To be added.

  • Roles

    Gets the roles associated with the resource.

    public System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection Roles { get; }

    Property Value

    • StringCollection

      A StringCollection collection containing the roles whose authorization must be verified.

    Remarks

    The Roles property is a list of roles that are granted or denied access to the resource. There must be at least one value in either the Users property collection or the Roles property collection, or both.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use this property. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
           
            // Set the action property.
            authorizationRule.Action = 
               AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow;
            // Define the new rule to add to the collection.
            authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName");
            authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin");
            authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST");

            // Add the new rule to the collection.
            authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
      ' Set the action property.
        authorizationRule.Action = _
        AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow
      ' Define the new rule to add to the collection.
      authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName")
      authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin")
      authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST")
      
      ' Add the new rule to the collection.
      authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule)
  • Users

    Gets the users associated with the resource.

    public System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection Users { get; }

    Property Value

    • StringCollection

      A StringCollection collection containing the users whose authorization must be verified.

    Remarks

    The Users property is a list of users that are granted or denied access to the resource. There must be at least one value in either the Users property collection or the Roles property collection, or both.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use this property. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
           
            // Set the action property.
            authorizationRule.Action = 
               AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow;
            // Define the new rule to add to the collection.
            authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName");
            authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin");
            authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST");

            // Add the new rule to the collection.
            authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
      ' Set the action property.
        authorizationRule.Action = _
        AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow
      ' Define the new rule to add to the collection.
      authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName")
      authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin")
      authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST")
      
      ' Add the new rule to the collection.
      authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule)
  • Verbs

    Gets the verbs associated with the resource.

    public System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection Verbs { get; }

    Property Value

    • StringCollection

      A StringCollection collection containing the verbs whose authorization must be verified.

    Remarks

    The Verbs property is a comma-separated list of HTTP transmission methods that are granted or denied access to the resource.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to access this property. 

                // Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
           
            // Set the action property.
            authorizationRule.Action = 
               AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow;
            // Define the new rule to add to the collection.
            authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName");
            authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin");
            authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST");

            // Add the new rule to the collection.
            authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule);

          ' Using the AuthorizationRuleCollection Add method.
      ' Set the action property.
        authorizationRule.Action = _
        AuthorizationRuleAction.Allow
      ' Define the new rule to add to the collection.
      authorizationRule.Users.Add("userName")
      authorizationRule.Roles.Add("admin")
      authorizationRule.Verbs.Add("POST")
      
      ' Add the new rule to the collection.
      authorizationSection.Rules.Add(authorizationRule)
